math_problem.A317: Let $\mathbb{R}^{+}$ be the set of positive real numbers. Find all functions $f:\mathbb{R}^{+}\rightarrow\mathbb{R}^{+}$ such that, for all $x, y \in \mathbb{R}^{+}$ , \[f(xy + f(x)) = xf(y) + 2\] Instead of determining all positive real-valued functions on the positive reals that satisfy the given functional equation, simply find \(k = f(1) - 2\), where \(f(1)\) is the value at 1 of any such function.

math_problem.A552: Determine all \(\alpha \in \mathbb{R}\) such that for every continuous function \(f:[0,1] \rightarrow \mathbb{R}\), differentiable on \((0,1)\), with \(f(0)=0\) and \(f(1)=1\), there exists some \(\xi \in(0,1)\) such that \(f(\xi)+\alpha=f^{\prime}(\xi)\).
